website_summaries.verdict: For those who have a home stocked with "smart" products, this will be the personal assistant for you. If having a more powerful speaker is also important, the Echo can supply.
pros: Compatible with just about any smart device you could have – lights, electronics, thermostats and more
For those who find themselves constantly buying products on Amazon, you can easily do so by talking to your Echo
And no one can complain about the drop in price
A small but nice bonus  – free calls to anywhere in the U.S., Canada and Mexico
cons: If you already have an Echo, it might not be worth the upgrade
Besides an improvement in speakers and noise cancellation, the two generations are very similar

website_summaries.verdict: A voice-controlled smart speaker that fits a lot into its compact design. Exceptionally great value for the money considering what it can do.
pros: Easily combines with other speakers in range for true surround sound
Big bass provided by subwoofer pairs with tweeter for crystal-clear mids and treble
Voice activation from Alexa can perform a plethora of tasks
cons: Sound can come out distorted when turned up very loud

website_summaries.verdict: The Echo is a solid pick among voice-enabled personal assistant devices. Offers an enjoyable mix of practicality and fun.
pros: Continues to add more apps and features
Wi-Fi performance and speaker quality at low tones are solid
Good integration with other Amazon services
cons: Not as many factual answers as Google Assistant
Tower design is a little tall for some locations
Doesn't connect with several Apple services

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was hoping for.
customer_reviews.text: Not responsive. I am returning it. Amaozn is sending another one. I hope the new one is better. I also have a Dot, it response every time. I sure hope the new one works as well as the dot does. The top lights up like it hears me but nothing happen. If I give it the same command over and over again eventually it will work. Not what I was hoping for.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Not AI in the least
customer_reviews.text: Can't understand much. I get so frustrated trying to get it to play music and it doesnt understand commands unless perfectly formulated in specific ways (I am native English, so not an accent issue). I just got done arguing with her because it says "streaming on another device? would you like to stream from here instead." but it neither understands "yes", or "Alex, stream from this device"...or "play from this device". In all cases it just says "I cant understand that." or says "here's a playlist you might like...oh, Alexa is streaming on another device. would you...." There wasn't any streaming elsewhere. I gave up and left it....I wanted to throw it across the room.
customer_reviews.author: Colin MacKenzie

customer_reviews.title: Does Weird Things
customer_reviews.text: I like the Echo devices. I have four of them. This one, though, is a little buggy. Unlike the others, it has trouble understanding me, answers questions or plays songs completely unrelated to what I asked, and has needed to be reset to reconnect to the internet. It recently made a phone call, unrequested, to someone I don't know (I was home alone and suddenly heard a phone ringing in another part of the house and then somebody saying "hello? hello?". A little freaky). The 2nd generation Echo doesn't seem to work as well as the original. At least mine doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: Calli

customer_reviews.title: Works amazingly well after the most recent update
customer_reviews.text: I ordered three of these at launch and was extremely disappointed by the sound when I first got them. After reading some reviews, I decided to update for the new update amazon pushed out and can say that the quality is definitely better than the original amazon echo. The bass is actually there lol. I highly recommend picking these up!
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE: Amazon Randomly Selects Devices and LISTENS to Your Conversations
customer_reviews.text: Beware Buyers: Amazon Randomly Selects Devices and LISTENS to Your Conversations in an effort to improve the technology. You sacrifice your privacy as they can listen to any conversation at any time and guess what- the Echo is on all the time. I should have returned my units but now I'm stuck with them. Hope they update their privacy policy and allow users to decide if they okay with their conversations being listened to or prefer to opt out.
customer_reviews.author: Scout242

customer_reviews.title: Worked only for about a year
customer_reviews.text: We loved having the Echo, even bought one for the kids and a second one for us. However, now after a year of usage the first echo we bought in early December 2017 fades in and out. At first I thought maybe it was the internet connection but we have two dots and another echo and none of them fade in and out. We have used this device most every day so maybe it is wearing out? Nonetheless very disappointed if the unit will only last a year. Lke to hear if anyone else is having this issue and did you find a way to resolve it.
customer_reviews.author: GK Reader

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife for Christmas. I gave it to her today and this thing is awesome. Easy to set up which is what I worried about the most. Great sound, and does exactly what it's supposed to do. Pretty cool little chunk of technology.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Hughes

customer_reviews.title: I have to say this is the worst experience I have ever had with Amazon
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a Christmas gift for a friend. He was not able to activate it. No mater what he did, it would not connect to the internet. We had at least 3 other people try to get it to work, people who are more experienced with electronics that we were. They failed as well. Finally we gave up. The window to return it was January 31. At that point we were still hopeful we would get it working. Never happened and now we can't return it. I have to say this is the worst experience I have ever had with Amazon. Julie Johnson
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Both Echos that I purchased continuously saying "Sorry I'm having trouble understanding you" I made a huge mistake investing so much in these as my sources of music to my speakers with 4 DOTs and the main echos are constantly coming off line and it is impossible to completely reset them. NO Assistance at all from the company just get directed to go to "help" DO NOT BUY MORE THAN 1 they break in less than a year Amazon called me after this review. Echos still not working again. I set everything up as they suggested. Their Rep was incredibly nice and helpful with other aspects but still No reasons as to why this keeps happening.
customer_reviews.author: Kimber

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: No one told me that in order to use this I would have to ALSO purchase a Fire Tablet for 79.00 so I can use the Alexis app. I am on ss and disability and don't have a cell phone either. I am livid. I could not afford this, but my husband died so I thought it would at least give me music in the house, but no. I would have never bought it if I knew it was going to cost me about$150.00, not 69.99.
customer_reviews.author: Suzie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 94 year old vision impaired father and I can't say enough about it. Dad has been using it for a week now and absolutely loves it! He has already learned to get the news and weather, listens to the books in his Kindle library and his favorite radio stations (even asks it to play a specific artist) , plays Jeopardy, asks it to tell him a joke and makes hands free phone calls. He often uses his headphones with it for privacy and said today he's no longer bored. He had originally asked about a WiFI radio but this is so much more! I would highly recommend this - totally exceeded our expectations.
customer_reviews.author: kathy from MI

customer_reviews.title: Best Voice Assistant Speaker
customer_reviews.text: Standard Alexa functionality, with better sound than the first generation Echo! I have both a first-gen echo and a Google Home, and this definitely beats both in terms of sound quality. Fuller bass, but not overly punchy like the Google Home and still provides clear mids and highs. I have this one sitting next to my TV which has a FireTV stick, it's awesome to be able to tell Alexa to start a show or pause it without reaching for the remote.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: I played music on it and the quality was very poor, in agreement with most reviews here
customer_reviews.text: SOUND QUALITY REVIEW I bought this product after reading about the sound issues and the following software updates that fixed the quality. The second I got the device, I played music on it and the quality was very poor, in agreement with most reviews here. I then waited for the echo to get the software update and played the same songs. The sound quality difference was insane! I couldn't believe it is possible to make such a big difference with just software. It was a fun little experiment to run, and I'm happy with my new Echo. Certainly an upgrade from my echo dot!
customer_reviews.author: Raúl Pegan

customer_reviews.title: My Amazon dot seems better it appeared to respond quicker and the Echo despite ...
customer_reviews.text: My Amazon dot seems better it appeared to respond quicker and the Echo despite its so- called omni-directional microphone doesnt "hear" me most of the time like my dot did and it is sitting in the same exact spot. I hook my stereo up to it to play my "Amazon unlimited" music which is great. I haven't used the Blu-tooth setup yet so maybe the score will improve . And again this is based on comparing the two against one another. I really want to return the Echo but I threw away the box . Not a norm for me . Can you make a return without the original box??
customer_reviews.author: Rudaleholt

customer_reviews.title: Think Twice Before Getting An Echo.
customer_reviews.text: After returning a far more expensive HomePod from Apple because it couldn't seem to follow commands, within hearing range from their technical support team, I decided to try the Echo after I read that it could link up with some of my Apple products in an Apple Centric home. Books on how to use it are far and few between. The one I got with 1001 tips might as well be written in Urdu. Few of the tips work. So yet again, another technology product that while it may work for some doesn't work for me. I couldn't recommend it and may return it.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Krug

customer_reviews.title: What a cool product. Its become our go to house music ...
customer_reviews.text: What a cool product. Its become our go to house music producer. We added the $4/month Amazon music subscription with access to 10 million songs. You can ask Alexa anything and get some pretty sweet answers. We love it.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Dean

customer_reviews.title: Another homerun by amazon
customer_reviews.text: This upgrade to the new alexa is well worth it the new speaker really packs a punch and it looks so much better than the original. Only flaw is when playing spotify and giving the stop command there seema to be a delay where the music will resume for a second and then stop. This did not happen with the original it just stopped immiediatly. Im sure this is something that will be taken care of with a software update!
customer_reviews.author: anthony dileo

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love the Echo
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love the Echo! I made my cat a playlist of frog croaks, bird tweets, gregorian monk chants and cat purrs. This echo tells me how long my drive to work is, weather, sports updates, news. Reads Wikipedia articles, reads my kindle books, sets alarms, tells jokes. Now that I have Alexa I dumped my boyfriend for intelligent conversation. Thanks Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Beth Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Love this item
customer_reviews.text: Love this item! Alexa is our new best friend. My Significant Other suffered a Spinal Cord Injury and has limited use of his hands which makes using a cell phone difficult. The Echo allows him to make hands free calls which has been a life saver for us!
customer_reviews.author: Crankycaregiver

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE MY ECHO!
customer_reviews.text: Now I know why all my friends love ECHO/Alexa! This is really an awesome product and it was reasonably price. I upgraded from the simple puck to the tower and the Alexa with screen view is next. These really make things so much more simple. These are perfect for busy Families, kids who like to listen to music/audio books or ask questions, singles who live alone to control lights, etc. And I really love the Alexa View for aging parents. The capability to sync with security systems such as RING is the icing on top of the cake. Am really enjoying exploring all the features..
customer_reviews.author: Missy Juanita L. Shaffer

customer_reviews.title: Perhaps try Google Home
customer_reviews.text: Honestly I wish we could send it back. The first week it was an amazing tool to have the house but ever since it’s been glitchy and inconsistent. We can’t stream anything longer than 10 minutes without it stopping and shutting off. Our internet is great so that isn’t the issue. We can’t stream Pandora, Spotify, AZ sports...anything. Everything glitches. So frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria

customer_reviews.title: Works as Advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Works well and most of the skills work out of the box. I only found the skill for the Personal Weather Station not to work. The smart home devices work flawlessly. Its nice not to have to search out my phone to turn on or off lights, cameras or change my thermostats. Music sounds very good for such a small footprint. Not a data hog either. Only uses data when streaming or responding to your commands unlike Google Home which constantly eats data. Good for a limited data connection.
customer_reviews.author: M. Graves

customer_reviews.title: Not up to the hype
customer_reviews.text: Alexa works fine if you don't ask her to do too much. I set up a system about a year ago and things worked reasonably well for a while but about a month ago things started getting buggy and responses became inconstant. I don't know if having 6 echoes just made things to complex or if like most computers inefficiencies snowballed over time. In any event, don't set up a system with the idea that it will simplify your life because in fact you will spend far more time troubleshooting problems than you would just switching things on by hand.
customer_reviews.author: L. Tholl

customer_reviews.title: Got a 2nd Echo for stereo sound. You should too.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a second Echo for the express purpose of taking advantage of the new, "Stereo Pairing" feature. I had a little trouble getting real stereo at first, but the excellent Amazon customer service team stuck with me until we got it working properly. My one complaint about these smart speakers has always been that they play music in mono. I wish I didn't have to pay another $100 to get stereo sound, but now that I have it, it sounds great! Now if we could only get Amazon to stream high bit rate audio. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Jodi Jolly

customer_reviews.title: Ok... (Update: Not ok)
customer_reviews.text: I tried to cancel order after reading reviews, but it was too late. Kind of glad. About 10 minutes after setting it up Alexa came on and said it was going to do an update. I think the sound is better, but then all I have are Dots to compare it with. I gave it only 3 stars because when I asked her to play a singer from My Music it took quite a while to kick in - Dot is much quicker. Update: After listening more since first review Alexa and Audible books sound extremely muffled. Very irritating. Got to drop a star. May return.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Audible Journal!
customer_reviews.text: I love that I can use Alexa to remind me of chores, appointments, and tasks that have to be completed at certain times, or on future dates. She remembers everything I ask of her. When I ask her to play "my music," she knows to choose from music I have purchased over the years, and plays cuts from all my favorite cd's. I like playing Jeopardy with her every morning, as well, even though I'm terrible at trivia! I live alone, and I'm not embarrassed to talk to her during the day and get suggestions on different subjects. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Marcia F. Grunwaldt

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Ordered it to use to listen to talk radio. Enabled stations on App as directed. Alexa struggled to conn ct or find what I was looking for, even when done as directed BY Amazon! I found it NOT easy to integrate and to respond to my commands. Age 50 and use computers daily, but it has become obvious that some technology is becoming more difficult to maneuver and while the younger generations may think, "seriously? You couldn't figure it out!? It's SO easy!" It IT WILL happen to u too....make it SIMPLE: 1. download app 2. Add whatever it is you'd like to listen to 3. Voila! Finished...... But.it wasn't.... Had such high hopes, so sad.
customer_reviews.author: TaraE

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for aging parents
customer_reviews.text: The great thing about the new Echo- it supports calls. Have elderly parents, life alert type devices are good but often left on sinks or nightstands. I put this in the living room and 2 echo dots in other parts of the house. If someone falls- they only need to say "alexa, call Matt's cell". It doesn't support 911- but they would probably spend the night on the floor rather than call 911. If i don't answer- they can go down their list of contacts- my sister, brother, neighbor etc.
customer_reviews.author: Matt S

customer_reviews.title: Alexa is the best
customer_reviews.text: I really didn't see much need for home assistants like the Echo until I won one at my office Christmas party. I quickly became so addicted that I bought this second one a week later. Alexa is great in the kitchen (timers and unit conversions), wonderful at entertaining (music and games), and incredibly helpful (answering questions and controlling lights). I have to admit that my wife has not yet warmed up to the idea of asking Alexa to turn on and off lights, but she definitely enjoys having Alexa play music and getting quick answers to questions. Be forewarned, getting an Echo will forever change your life.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Barton

customer_reviews.title: I seem to have a sassy Alexa and have disconnected it.
customer_reviews.text: My niece hooked it up for me and gave the original commands. She was direct with Alexa but not sassy. Alexa refused to play messages for me and told me to go to the app. When I repeated the order, it started playing some music, that I didn't care for and every time I asked it to play the message that was indicated with the yellow ring, she just elevated the music. I don't need this kind of aggravation in my daily life and was very disappointed with this device.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Nancy

customer_reviews.title: don't know
customer_reviews.text: This thing is constantly sending error reports. Sometimes the sound comes from the unit and then will switch and come from my computer. I have no idea what the problem is. When I ask it to play music and it does the music is good, but it does not always respond. I did not want to put a review yet until I could find out what the problem is but I keep being ask to review it. So at this time can only give it a 3. When it works it is wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Jean

customer_reviews.title: Every home needs one
customer_reviews.text: I have the Echo placed in my kitchen and Alexa has become my new best friend! She plays my audio books and favorite music, makes my grocery list, places phone calls for me, gives me the news update, and even tells me the temperature outside. I know I haven't even begun to figure out all she is capable of doing. Alexa provides a lot of helpful information and assistance but is this a necessity? No, but it is just plain fun to play around with. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: juliek

customer_reviews.title: Alexa is great, but talks wayyy too much!
customer_reviews.text: Every skill that I've tried, feature I've used, or otherwise function of my Echo/Alexa has been great. Don't get me wrong. The reason I gave 3 stars is because Alexa never shuts up with, "If you want to follow us on facebook....", or, "For another dose of trivia..." or, "...to learn more about this skill, check out....". After using my Echo/Alexa for so many years, along with basically the same skills throughout the same time, I'd like to see these superfluous (and mildly annoying) boilerplate responses either cut from the routine responses, or just give long-time users the option to disable these time-wasting statements.
customer_reviews.author: JEG

customer_reviews.title: Good Assistant.
customer_reviews.text: I have to learn to use it for everything it can do. I also have an echo dot that I keep in the bedroom and they do basically the same thing EXCEPT the sound on this one is booming! Nice subwoofer. I play music when I'm cleaning house. Play ambient sounds when I'm reading. Turn on gadgets. Play games with it. It's not just for fun and games, it's a good assistant for checking the web and keeping appointments. I like it a lot and it was easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Glenda Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Jury is still out...
customer_reviews.text: I bought Alexa during the Black Friday sale. It was easy to set up, has very good sound and easily recognizes my voice and the commands I give. So far, I mostly use it as a voice-command music device. Sometimes I ask it the weather and also for news headlines but have not really discovered yet what other tasks I might use it for. I don't have any Alexa-enabled devices so I may add some as I learn more about it. I am impressed with the technology for sure but the jury is still out if this will become technology I integrate into my life or an amusement that ends up in a drawer within a few months.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: We love Alexa!
customer_reviews.text: I have a family of 5 including 3 children under 11. Alexa has been a great addition to our family! From impromptu dance offs to family game night, kids court for discussions and disagreements, timers and reminders, updates on package tracking, and making calls, sending texts, and more while hands free —we love it! The drop in feature comes in handy when trying to call the kids down from upstairs for dinner too! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Tami W

customer_reviews.title: Love my Alexa!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this during Prime Day which made it make more sense. Also FireTV. Both work really well. I have fiber optic internet which Alexa connects to through wifi, which is still very fast at 20Mbps. Although Alexa seems to lose connection or cut out during certain times of the day when Amazon's servers must be jammed with millions of people all streaming content, it's for now an acceptable annoyance in exchange for being able to say, "Alexa, what's the Dodgers score?" or "Alexa, play Mozart" and the sound quality of Alexa is surprisingly good (Bose-like in that it really booms out clear, rich sound) My wife and I love it and very happy we bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Skypix

customer_reviews.title: I think my Alexa is possessed.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had Alexa for a while and suddenly the past couple weeks it’ll randomly play songs on full volume , and the other night I was on the phone and it meowed like a cat and told me “ sorry I can’t help you” And I can care less that the Alexa listens to everything you say. I’m just more terrified when “take me out to the ballgame” plays on full blast when I’m resting. I do not know about you but that would probably scare the poop out of you too.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia

customer_reviews.title: Alexa the most fluent AI since who HAL 2000?
customer_reviews.text: Me: So I'm getting used to Alexa Alexa: "Yes Whit I've added 10 lb of sausage to your list.." Me: Alexa remove the sausage! Alexa: "From where.. your pants?" Me: it's so convenient to get information from Alexa if you want ... Alexa: "Yes you want more orders of Girls in Prison movies..?" Me: argggghh Alexa clear my browsing history Alexa: "okay playing Prison Blues radio from your Pandora account" Me: Alexa stop the music! Alexa: "okay play the Day the music Died by Don McClean" Me: Grrrrrrrggg Alexa shutup! Alexa: "That's not polite to say. Reordering wireless charger, Wild Bleuberrie jams and KY sensations from your list.." Me: $%^&*$%!!!%% <sigh>
customer_reviews.author: Whit

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed, not recommended
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed with my echo device. After one year it is not working very well. I mostly use to listen to music with Amazon Music app and in the last three months Bluetooth connection doesn’t work properly I need to de register and register it again and even doing that still not working. However my Bluetooth connection with other devices works perfectly even using the same Amazon music app, what brings me to the conclusion that is a issue with the Echo device not my phone or the connection. It is disappointed because we really enjoy Amazon and I am surprise for the mal functioning of one of their products, I do not recommend this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo Cuesta

customer_reviews.title: Better Than The Original
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to order this after all the comments and reviews about poor audio quality. I am happy to say that the latest software update has dramatically improved the sound quality. It seems to produce a louder volume than the first generation. I also hear a more full sounding bass. Some people may not agree with that depending on the type of music you are listening to. Most anything with a steady thumping bass will not sound as good as it would through a subwoofer. Most other types of music sound rich and full. I enjoy old and new country music and it sounds great.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Cavanaugh

customer_reviews.title: Echo
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my dad for Christmas, who every time my brother talked about a smart this or that, kept asking, "will this work with my iPod?" Well, I got him a smart speaker than will work with the new iPod my mom bought him only to find out he was just asking out of curiosity, supposedly. It's a nice speaker. He likes that you can move it around and don't have to keep it plugged in like his other one. It has a clear sound and is loud enough that my mostly deaf father can hear it perfectly well. I have no regrets, and I'm sure he doesn't either.
customer_reviews.author: Katrina

customer_reviews.title: Great gadget but loses connectivity frequently
customer_reviews.text: I really like the Echo, but the one thing that I am rating 3 stars is the connectivity issues I am having. I have had to restart the echo a couple of times already, I have had to reset my connections, my router, and I am still having issues. I am not having issues with any of my other connected devices, smart tv, computer, phones, roku, etc. Alexa works great, when it is connected but I am growing a bit impatient with all this loss of connectivity.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Cuestas

customer_reviews.title: ALexa is not aging well!
customer_reviews.text: We use this product to more easily control some of our smart lights (Philips). Alexa can understand most of what we ask, but there are sudden responses to what is picked up on television or conversations between people that are not address to the device. There is also frequent "I'm having trouble connecting to the internet" comments when we do ask lights to be controlled. So we often mute the speaker to prevent outbursts, or disconnect power to get the device to reconnect to the internet. Out previous device seemed to work much better, until it totally died. I would think the devices and software would improve over time, not get worse. Too bad.
customer_reviews.author: McDuff

customer_reviews.title: Perfect/Must have for anyone who loves music
customer_reviews.text: We listen to music so much in our house and this product has only made that habit so much worse! We constantly have something on! It’s amazing and we love it so much! Its so fast and convenient and paired with Amazon music unlimited, you have a set up that you can listen to absolutely anything anytime you want! I know it does so much more but it is by far our favorite just because of the music! The speaker quality is so clear. Can’t say enough good things about it!
customer_reviews.author: Katie Tarver Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Monthly Fees
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoyed the Echo for the first month! It was nice getting almost any song or artist on cue. However, I now realize that you need Amazon Unlimited to keep these options after the free trial so I'm debating whether to pay $8/month for that. I think this should be made clearer but this was a gift so I wasn't aware. $8 isn't a lot but it all adds up when you have other "small" monthly fees such as Sirius, etc. The sound is good.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Just had to get another
customer_reviews.text: This is our third echo plus a tap. Love the new design and colors. It does sound better. With all the new Alexa features like drop in (intercom per se) and multi room music multiple devices work great for us. While I am writing this there is a buy 3 special. So tempted to replace the older 2 taller towers with new ones. At that price I just might. If you own an echo I won't rave about it you already know. If you don't own one spend a $100 and get one. Trust me you will want to buy more. And check out Alexa's skill set from making calls to prime music
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Limited music available
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for music purposes mostly. Seems like every song we request is not available with my prime membership, and requires the purchase of Amazon music to play. Not really what I expected but okay I guess. We have just learned to use our ipod again. If I had known this, probably would not have purchased and I think at this point it is to late to return.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy

customer_reviews.title: Don’t bother. It’s garbage.
customer_reviews.text: POS that doesn’t even work out of the box, never stays connected to internet. Even if I reset and do set up again it drops connection and doesn’t work at all. Yeah, if it can’t commect to the internet then you’re just SOL. Now won’t even make a WiFi for art ho so is literally just a hunk of junk sitting on the counter. Had no problems with first generation. Throwing this in the garbage and getting my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Michael allen

customer_reviews.title: These are so frustrating
customer_reviews.text: I've bought 7 of these for multi room music, but they never work. In the past year I've gotten the "everywhere" to play only three times . They keep going offline and then you have to go through and re sync them one by one which will make you want to pull your hair out. They don't set up easy at all. They're just collecting dust and are a complete waist of money. If you only have one, you'll be okay. But when you start adding multiple devices, you will start running into all kinds of problems
customer_reviews.author: illintent14

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, product. I love it. I had problems getting it to work. I had to call Tech Help to come and upload it. He also had to get it going through my phone instead of PC. Which the cost for that was as much as the product itself. A little dissappointed I had to pay twice as much as advertised. Except for the added cost, since I couldn't figure it out, even though I followed all directions you sent with it. Troubleshooting didn't help either. But, everything works great now.
customer_reviews.author: Denice M. Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Alexa like kids!
customer_reviews.text: We enjoy our Amazon Echo and smart plugs. The grand kids love getting Alexa to say silly things and control the lamps. Our youngest grandson has some speech issues and can't say the "L" sound. So, he yells "Wexa, turn on Grandma's Wamp". She obeys! Now we all call her Wexa.
customer_reviews.author: Old nerd

customer_reviews.title: This is the most awesome device I have
customer_reviews.text: This is the most awesome device I have. The news, weather and sports all read to me in the morning, plus all the skills its has. This is a must have for people who are on the go in the morning, and the device is wonderful to come home too. Keeps me updated on things I want to know, including the stock market. With the music unlimited, I have the best music at my command. Amazon hit it out of the park with this.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Butry

customer_reviews.title: my life is complete now it's truly amazing.. sound feels really immersive
customer_reviews.text: 6 stars... my life is complete now it's truly amazing.. sound feels really immersive.. mics are super sensitive can easily catch your voice from a good 12+ feet without even trying... skills are great too.. this is my 2nd alexa device ( 1st being fire hd 10 ) but this one is way more sensitive.. i also like how the two devices intercommunicate to determine which is closer and which can provide better response.. also i love the design and how its more furniture/decor accessory than an actual bulky speaker.. gray blends in perfectly
customer_reviews.author: Oscar

customer_reviews.title: Jeff Bezos' Big Sister replacing Aldous Huxley's Big Brother
customer_reviews.text: Still experimenting. Need to hone my voice recognition, My echoes all respond differently right now which is a little curious. Overall they are quite fun and have pretty decent sound for their size. Well worth the purchase especially if you can find a good sale...just be patient, there are lots of specials throughout the year. She listens better than most women I know - that could be a good thing or a bad thing.
customer_reviews.author: Pixx

customer_reviews.title: an improvment over echo 1
customer_reviews.text: Sound is somewhat better than the original and setup was easier than the original. Currently I'm using the old echo as a dot replacement in areas that I can appreciate music due to it's better sound. The new dots seem to have a tone problem, which makes it sound muffled no matter how you set the eq. These I use in my garage, bathroom etc, where sound quality isn't an issue. I realize you have to be realistic considering the speaker size but the dot upgrade is questionable unless Amazon does a software upgrade.. That said, the replacement echo has an improved sound, without adjusting the eq which is the way it should be.
customer_reviews.author: Jaymis

customer_reviews.title: I love this Echo (2nd generation) for the music and all ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this Echo (2nd generation) for the music and all the apps! Alexa is great fun and I really enjoy the features I use. I review the Alexa skills now and then and add them for fun or as needed. I use the mute button when I am on the phone in case I accidentally mention her name--the blue light will come on--. I love the Flash Briefing app. I have it set up for the latest news as well as a few other favorites in a concise overview. I like the relaxing nature sounds and Gregorian chants. I like also that I can get any music from any era and genre...the dolby sound system is GREAT!
customer_reviews.author: fan in DC

customer_reviews.title: Highly dangerous Faulty power box
customer_reviews.text: Who do I report a fire caused by the power box on our Alexa. We came home just in time. We have had our Alexa for just over 1 yr. The plug that comes with the Alexa caused an electrical fire in my sons room today. We walked in just as it’s sparked a flame. His room was engulfed in smoke. We were gone for about 2 hours and were not to be home for another 4 when we decided to leave early. Thank God. I would like to speak with someone regarding this matter.
customer_reviews.author: Joann Winters

customer_reviews.title: Echo devices invade privacy
customer_reviews.text: I received this device as part of the purchase of a new smart home. After the Echo was installed and setup by the installer, I unplugged it and put it in a closet and do not intend on using it because I don't need it to operate my other smart devices. Echo devices are a great technology, but I've seen news articles where Amazon employees listen and use it for their amusement. I've also seen news articles where recorded statements from these devices were subpoenaed to use in court to prosecute people. These devices invade my privacy and I don't want anything in my home that records everything that I or my family say.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Woke up to Alexa telling me I was going to die
customer_reviews.text: This morning, I had the pleasure of Alexa waking me up telling me verbatim "In one month, chemical 112 will cause the world to explode" before going silent. You can imagine how disturbing that can be to wake up to. Later found out that was a plot from a 1957 movie. How and why Alexa decided to relay that little tidbit of noninformation is beyond my understanding, but from my time with the device, it only seems to work decently as a music player and alarm clock. Past that, this device is frustrating, surprisingly stubborn, and even dangerous with the weird things it tells people like what it told me. I wish I never purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: jesse

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound and smart too!
customer_reviews.text: We've had Amazon Echo, Dot, Fire TV Stick and Tablet devices in our home since the 1st generations came out. Overall, I've been very happy with them. The only problem we've had is our first 1st Gen Echo started losing its connection after the first year. If we unplug it and plug it back in it starts working again, (yes, we tried a hard reset, etc). I think it's going to be recycled soon. The sound from this 2nd gen Echo is excellent to me, (I'm no audiophile.) We have an Echo or Dot in almost every room in the house. We even have one in the garage, in case I lock myself out...
customer_reviews.author: Ezrway

customer_reviews.title: Impressive device. So much smarter than Siri.
customer_reviews.text: Impressive device. So much smarter than Siri. We have a brand new 2nd gen unit and we already love it. With all the available skills and the ease of use, this is an amazing useful piece of tech. We are so excited. It understands everything we are asking for and so far has delivered answers that are accurate and on point. I was not aware of all the apps and services that can be used with this. And yes, you can connect your iPhone via bluetooth and play Apple Music via streaming. However with Amazon Music memberships dirt cheap I don’t see why you would not do that instead.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney Gracia

customer_reviews.title: Love the 2nd Generation
customer_reviews.text: I got this device as a second in my home as a gift. Before I received it I was aware of all of the sound complaints. As soon as I set it up, I went immediately to play music. I thought the music sounded fine, maybe not as full and rich as the 1st Generation one. In the middle of the song, I got a notification that there was an important update. The update pushed the same version that the other reviewers reference. The sound is fantastic and I have no complaints. Love the design, love the sound. Considering getting even more.
customer_reviews.author: Kyleresq

customer_reviews.title: great just as i expected
customer_reviews.text: Bought this second one for my 95 yr old mom since she can't see an alarm clock , can't read, and is hard of hearing. She loves it! It gets loud enough for her to hear so I download books for her to listen to. She can set the alarm easily and ask Alexa for time, weather and anything she has questions about. She also likes listening to some of her favorite songs from long long ago! She recently had a stay in the hospital and everyday she would tell me that she misses her Alexa. :)
customer_reviews.author: K. McGrath

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth connection notification cannot be disabled!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this speaker for 2 years and I finally threw it in the trash. It constantly interrupted me with it's stupid bluetooth connection notifications. I'd be very focused on my work and all of a sudden this speaker blurted out it's bluetooth connection notification and it jolted me. I'd be in virtual meetings and it would blurt out its bluetooth connection notification out of no where. And the crazy thing is that there is an Amazon staff member told me that Bluetooth connection notification cannot be disabled! What! The speaker sounded great. Did voice recognition great. But the bluetooth connection notifications made me throw it in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: David Frey

customer_reviews.title: keeps losing wifi
customer_reviews.text: It works ok I guess... I expected more from a gen2 though. Alexa still can't understand me half the time, doesn't wait long enough for me to talk, can't do basic things like tell me store hours or whether or not its raining outside. The speaker is louder than before, but not exactly better. And most annoyingly, every 7-10 days or so, it just forgets about my wifi and I have to set it up all over again. Super annoying. None of my gen1 Alexa devices have this problem. Overall, I'd rate this thing a meh with a capital M.
customer_reviews.author: Common Cents

customer_reviews.title: *Update* The update fixed the sound!
customer_reviews.text: New review - the update to the firmware amazon told me they were pushing FIXED the issues I was having!! I'm really glad they were able to fix it but I am more glad they actually called and talked about the feedback and did something to rectify it. Really made me appreciate the company even more! Thanks for fixing the issue and now I love my new echo again!!! Original - I'm confused by the "improved audio" statement. We have 3 first generations of this model and they all sound so much better. It's disappointing because I was so excited for this and it isn't what I was expecting. I may return it.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Campbell

customer_reviews.title: love it takes care of a number of lifes challanges
customer_reviews.text: I love being able to play music on request. My wife had a stroke in 2011 leaving her not able to read or write. I can use this for her to leave me messages and I can leave her a message. Over the past years I could not leave her a message because she could not read it. She loves the music , music is great thearpy for stroke patients. I love the music and its like having a super smart friend that can help with questions or the correct spelling of a word or just the weather , time or to tell me a joke . This is a win, win tool for life
customer_reviews.author: Charles McElfish

customer_reviews.title: Clear loud and a joy 2 listen 2.
customer_reviews.text: We have purchased the echo Dot The echo 2nd generation and the Echo Show. The best sound is the echo second generation. I absolutely enjoy listening to music on this product. I take it out on my back patio when I'm doing my yard work and it's projects such great sound quality all my neighbors get to listen in to. The Echo Show is supposed to have better sound quality I disagree it's just not loud enough you have to be in the same room with it to hear it good.
customer_reviews.author: bsjhaley

customer_reviews.title: Is the ECHO Nosey?
customer_reviews.text: I received this Echo as a part of a promotion with my local telephone carrier. I am just beginning to use it, and I'm sure I haven't taken advantage of every component it has to offer. I've hear so much about artificial intelligence invading one's privacy. Therefore, I am very hesitant to use it. I've just began to use voice intelligence, which is very handy when wanting to quickly hear the news, or songs from my favorite artists. I keep it in the kitchen for now, and away from my bedrooms. I don't wish for it to pick-up personal conversations not meant for the ears of others. Again, this has to do with my overarching concern about artificial intelligence.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it... It is almost too convenient
customer_reviews.text: Save the rhetoric about sky net and all that. Is Alexa ALWAYS listening...? Yeah, I am pretty sure she is. Regardless, my family loves this tower! We got a little one too, but the sound on that one craps. Just the same, we use Alexa so much, I catch myself out and about wanting to ask Alexa what the traffic is, what the weather is going to do or even what time is it Alexa, before catching myself and realizing she is not out with me. They need to work on that! And no... I am not buying a new car to get it. Arrived in good time and in good condition. Only occasional firmware issues.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Castles

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this edition. So check this out, my girlfriend wanted the echo dot instead right so we sold this one and got the dot, nope IF YOU ARE THINKING ABOUT DOING THAT, don’t!! I regret it and I’m thinking about rebuying this one but I can’t because I already have other speakers. This echo is so nice and luxurious, and the Dolby speakers are amazing I’m not joking the speakers on the dot are crap compared to these.
customer_reviews.author: Z

customer_reviews.title: Not life changing, but lots of fun!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a toy, but what a fun one! I actually got a kick out of it because it wouldn't play my granddaughter's music, but it plays mine just fine, and it will keep it up for as long as I like! It is also pretty good at answering general questions like converting Celsius to Fahrenheit which I need since I am horrid at conversion myself without a calculator. I expect to have a lot of fun with this thing, and it is also going to be useful since it does have a wide range of resources available on demand!
customer_reviews.author: Terry Story

customer_reviews.title: I get better coverage and the music sounds great at the volume ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought 8 of them including 2-Show units and replaced a house full of Bose SoundTouch units. I get better coverage and the music sounds great at the volume I usually play it at when I am home. We have a smart home so this also controls all of our 5-BAF fans throughout the house and all light switches, front door, garage ect. These units are amazing and so much more than a toy if used in a smart home. Some say they sound better than the Gen 1 Echo's and I say they sound about the same but love the smaller profile and the way you can dress them up to match your room.
customer_reviews.author: Trent

customer_reviews.title: A little cutie.
customer_reviews.text: If one must be a freak and own three of these in a one bedroom apartment, this one is starting to be a fave. My echo dot is hooked to an amp and plays big Klipsh speakers. Sometimes, you don't need all that action, this Echo fills the bill. A little too blankety blank chatty sometimes. Oh, my original Echo, that chick is the best $200 timer I ever bought. I need ALL THREE, I live in America.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Ann Broadus

customer_reviews.title: Does Alexa help when you're getting blind?
customer_reviews.text: I am very old and losing eyesight, so we thought Alexa could help with a few things. She does. She doesn't mind my foreign accent and she is very flexible. Only one time, she said: "I can't help you with that." It was when I asked her for exercises (I guess I'll use YouTube for that). I wish she could could find some science stories as well, she likes entertainment rather than education. Well, she finds the news, but that is rarely "information". She can do a lot of small things: give me my favorite opera, wake me up, remind me of stuff, checki my orders on Amazon, . So we are getting to know each other.
customer_reviews.author: Claude Lambert

customer_reviews.title: They're Everywhere!
customer_reviews.text: I love my Echo devices and this one was low priced on Amazon's Prime Day. This Echo is #5 in addition to 2 Firestick TV sticks. Everywhere I go in the house I'm in range of Alexa for questions, news, weather, music and all of the Alexa skills. I can hear music on all the echos simultaneously if I choose so I can be moving from room to room without missing the song or having a book read to me. The timer/alarm function is great for alerting me or assisting with cooking times. My lists can be prepared on my computer, by voice and accessed on my smartphone. Now they are everywhere and I'm happy!
customer_reviews.author: Daga1968

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: Music sound and Alexa are great. However, I am subtracting a star because it is my only Echo that will not re-connect itself to the WiFi after the occasional broadband-outage. I have to pull its power-plug and power-cycle it to get it to re-connect. It is especially troublesome because it is our main-one in the kitchen/living-room. Its WiFi works fine other than that. We have 4 other Echo units (most older, and some are just the small ones) but they all seem to re-connect themselves automatically just fine (without any help from me). I sure wish Amazon would release a firmware upgrade to fix it.
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, fast source of info in limited areas.  No help in other areas.
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised to find that Echo has almost no Bible knowledge. Bible questions that I asked that are available on the internet, could not be answered. If I asked for a specific Bible reference to be read, it couldn't do it. I was also surprised that Echo could not help me with crossword puzzles. Questions like: "How high is the Empire State Building," and "How many square feet in an acre" were answered quickly. I guess I need more time to see what Echo can do. So far, it's a fun novelty, but limited practical value to me.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis G. Morrill

customer_reviews.title: but I am not very good with it
customer_reviews.text: It is a very interesting piece of equipment. My husband knows how to use it, but I am not very good with it. We are both in our 80’s & some of these things are just beyond me!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Hartman.         mazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really great system
customer_reviews.text: Love the sound quality of the Echo 2. Also love the clean look of them. I ordered two of them to be able to setup a “stereo system”, and also enjoy the multi room connection function where you can play the same music simultaneously in different rooms. One thing I think needs improvement is the dual connection via mobile device. I use spotify and it recognizes the “stereo pair” automatically without needing bluetooth, however sometimes the bluetooth causes it to only connect to one, so usually I just turn off bluetooth if I’m using both. Another note is I turned up the bass on both, and they certainly can handle the extra bass, sounds great.
customer_reviews.author: crc711

customer_reviews.title: We love it!
customer_reviews.text: We love our Alexa. It’s truly amazing. While I don’t really feel great that some gadget is listening to everything said, it’s great for when you come back from drinks and all you want to hear is “centerfold” but can only remember a few words from the song. Seriously amazing how this thing can recognize a song from you humming a tune and blurting out a few random words. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kara Downing

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound!
customer_reviews.text: After being somewhat apprehensive about ordering the new 2nd generation Echo due to numerous initial comments about poor sound quality, my comfort level improved considerably after reading recent comments referencing a firmware update tat dramatically improved the sound. Took the plunge and ordered the new Echo on Thanksgiving for $79. After a couple minor hiccups setting it up due, most likely, to me, it was up and operating. The sound is fantastic and easily fills our 22’ x 17’ living room with vaulted ceilings. Thanks Amazon for a great product!
customer_reviews.author: MFP

customer_reviews.title: technically ridiculous
customer_reviews.text: WARNING: I have set up tv's phones, etc, but this is the most difficult project I have ever had the displeasure of trying to set up! After trying to set up by myself, I called the 800 number, only to be connected to someone I could barely understand. So for at least an hour and a half I STILL COULD NOT GET THIS THING CONNECTED! Ridiculous that the person who is supposed to help could not get it going for me. COULD NOT UNDERSTAND THE PERSON HELPING ME!
customer_reviews.author: hatescheapproducts

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Device for Seniors
customer_reviews.text: As a senior citizen with arthritis I purchased this device for mainly safety reasons. I have one by my bedside and one near my chair in the living room. I can have Alexa call 911, dial my friends and relatives, spell words when I'm typing, connect to IHeart Radio stations and podcasts, give weather reports, play trivia and read me books. It's fairly easy to use if you are familiar with smartphones and know your internet IP address. Setup after downloading the app to my smartphone was probably 5 minutes at the max I would highly recommend it and I have barely scratched the surface as to what Alexa can do.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Clark

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy Echo for podcasts or Audible multi device playback
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed in the Echo's inability to play back podcasts and Audible among more than one device. I bought five so that I could listen to Audible and podcasts as I work around the house. Echo does support multi device music and it's wonderful if that's what you're after. But why wouldn't Echo support it's own company Audible for multi device playback? Amazon advertises; "Multi-Room Music allows you to play and control music across supported Echo devices and compatible speakers at the same time." Yes, it does say music but is misleading. Amazon should add a disclaimer that multi room playback is supported for music only and no there media.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: DOESN'T SUPPORT SPANISH
customer_reviews.text: GLAD I GOT THESE AS FREEBIES ON BLACK FRIDAY. DISAPPOINTED IT DOESN'T SUPPORT SPANISH LANGUAGE. WAS GONNA SHARE IT WITH ELDERLY MOM WHO DOESN'T SPEAK ENGLISH, BUT IS STILL HUMAN AND LONELY. AMAZON NEEDS TO UPLOAD THIS LANGUAGE TO SELL TO ALL THE SPANISH POPULATION IN THE WORLD, AND KEEP UP WITH THE COMPETITORS NETFLIX, GOOGLE, AND SMARTPHONES...
customer_reviews.author: maggie perez

customer_reviews.title: I am in love
customer_reviews.text: I'm 63 and not real techy. I have started to create a Smart home. Alexa is turning on lights, where as before I would have to turn on 2 lights to get to the light I wanted. So energy saving. I've been listening to music from my childhood for hours on end. I have her connected to my Smart TV so at a command, she turns it on and I command her to Netflix. I am always seeking more knowledge so Alexa answers many math, geography or science questions. I love in the am, I get news and weather before getting out of bed. Set-up for me was fairly easy. Alexa and I will be great friends
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: The speaker is great. Sound is better with more high and lows
customer_reviews.text: I decided to buy a new Echo 2nd generation after my Echo 1st generation totally died out. I don't have everything back the way it was yet as I had Amazon Unlimited Music on 1st but I had to wait for the end of my contract so that I wouldn't have to pay for two subscriptions. I don't know how to drop 1st unit Unlimited Music. I had the 1st Echo for about 3 years. The speaker is great. Sound is better with more high and lows. I liked the manual volume control on 1st, twisting upper part of unit to increase or decrease volume. I need to look into learning how to do more with my Alexa!!
customer_reviews.author: David Bagby

customer_reviews.title: Update convinced me to keep it
customer_reviews.text: Like everyone else, I almost placed it right back in the box to return it. I decided to hold on to it for a couple of weeks since I had till Nov 30 to get my money back. The update that everyone is referencing really did improve the sound exponentially. Is the sound better than a Gen 1 Echo? No. Is it close? Yes. Close enough to convince me to keep it and hope they can keep tweaking the audio a little bit more instead of the rushed fix to prevent everyone from returning their new Echos. Overall I'm happy with the purchase now instead of the immediate regret in the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Blake Norwood

customer_reviews.title: Music better sounding Echo.
customer_reviews.text: Contrary to some reviews I have read, this version of the Echo sounds much better than the first generation (which sounded flat and uninteresting). The only issue I have is that the white part of the blue circle does not actually orientate towards the person speaking and seems to indicate a voice source somewhere else. It works fine and responds well, just that the rather neat behaviour of the first generation (whereby the white part of the circle in listen mode was orientated in your direction) made the older product seem more polished. Overall an excellent upgrade and I can actually listen to music on it now.
customer_reviews.author: PMJTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Make my life easy!!
customer_reviews.text: this makes my life easier, I love that I can be cleaning and playing music or XM radio. I wish that it was more responsive in understanding what we say to her, specifically when it comes to asking to her to play specific songs on amazon unlimited music and I wish I had the option to connect different types of devices for example a dot and a 2nd gen instead of having to purchase two 2nd gen devices for different rooms to have the music play through my house and I still have not figured out how to get her to turn off all the lights at the same time instead of saying it one by one.
customer_reviews.author: Ameeiey

customer_reviews.title: That Echo 2 is a must have in the household or business
customer_reviews.text: The highs on Echo, what can I say, the design of the outside to match my decor, the sound, the sound of the women’s voice, the skills and it can become great companion when your by your self or you need assistance when I am cooking. My lows, I would like to here her speak Spanish and English with out having to pick either or, more human like interactive abilities, little more power on the amp side, as far as sound quality. Overall I love this device, keep up the great work, looking forward to seeing your advancements on this device. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Recommend....I LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: I received this as a gift from my brother. I had been to his house and had a lot of fun with his. He surprised me with this and Echo Dot (2nd gen). They are both fun and useful--I use them as intercoms in the house, ask them to play music, ask for the weather when I don't have my phone or computer nearby, ask how local traffic is, ask for a joke.....and probably thousands of other things I haven't even tried yet! The first day I had it I asked what I could substitute for an ingredient I didn't have for a recipe!
customer_reviews.author: Brewjaz

customer_reviews.title: Beta anyone?
customer_reviews.text: Feels like Beta every day. I am actually disgusted at the number of times I have to repeat myself to be understood day after day, every single use. Almost broken really. I have resorted to swearing obscenities at "Alexa" in frustration. Going over my recordings on the Alexa app shows I am repeating myself almost every single use. 90% failure rate or more on first try! This product is not ready for use. I have lights, security, firetv's, ... really the works. I have 9 echo devices altogether... wish I didn't have a single one. My smartphone and smartthings hub are dependable and work the first time always. I hate you Alexa... I really do.
customer_reviews.author: All the Good Names are taken!

customer_reviews.title: Second Generation Kicks Ass
customer_reviews.text: I have a second generation for my bathroom so I can sing along to music in the shower, dont judge me haha. I also have a third generation in the living room down the hall. The second generations microphones are so good that it will hear me when I speak in the living room. The third generation will not hear me if I speak in the bathroom, even with the door open. These things are awesome. Im 100% an echo fan and will buy many more over the years for the house and garage and of course, as gifts. Worth the buy if you like using alexa. Great sound quality too! I listen to mine for hours a day.
customer_reviews.author: Maxwell Smart

customer_reviews.title: If you ever thought about purchasing, do it!
customer_reviews.text: Saw this as a black Friday deal and pulled the trigger. Hadn't planned on purchasing but now am so glad I did. This device is amazing! Set up was super easy with the Android app. Had it up and running in minutes. The sound is superb, connected to Pandora with no issues. One of the best sounding small speaker systems,and I own a lot of Bluetooth devices. The range of abilities of Alexa will astound you. It may take me weeks to discover all it can do. I recommend reading the online guide,it really helps
customer_reviews.author: Avonlakebud

customer_reviews.title: If buy 2 Alexas for 2 different households, it will not work
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 Alexas: 1 for my family and 1 for my brother who lives 300 miles away. For the entire first 1.5 years we BOTH had limited capabilities because for some reason Amazon linked them so if I played music 300 miles away in my home, he would go to Alexa to ask something and Alexa would say sorry, can't do that. It was weird so finally I went on online and found directions to delink them. But then his would not work AT ALL! So frustrating! Why can't you buy an Alexa for a friend? There is no 800 # to call so his Alexa just sits there not being used. We don't know what to do?
customer_reviews.author: LProcks

customer_reviews.title: Is it better than my original model?
customer_reviews.text: My original gen 1 was still working but had become tempermental and decided it would not hold the wifi signal anymore-so I traded it in on prime day for this one-I sort of miss the volume ring but over all this model is smaller and works just as well-I think the sound is much improved-it is very responsive-the only thing I really want is an ALEX version-I don't like yelling at a woman especially when alexa cheats on games-it would be nice to have a change and a guys voice-I believe SIRI offers a choice now-I find it hard to NOT have an Alexa around being used to it now
customer_reviews.author: Don Fox

customer_reviews.title: Where Alexa and Echo really shine
customer_reviews.text: Alexa and Echo really shine when you have more than one device in your house, you can use it as an intercom, you can have the same or different music playing in every room. If an alarm goes off in one room you can turn it off in another. I haven't had the opportunity to try the phone call feature yet, but I would imagine that is yet another benefit. There are literally hundreds of uses for the Echo I haven't even tried yet, like controlling the lights and thermostats. If you can find them on sale it's a bonus, but it is also well worth the regular retail price.
customer_reviews.author: Bubba Warbucks

product_meta.title: Echo (2nd Generation) - Smart speaker with Alexa and Dolby processing - Charcoal Fabric
feature_bullets: Meet Echo - Our flagship smart speaker that connects to Alexa to play music, set alarms and timers, answer questions, control smart home devices, and more. Fits best in communal spaces, like living and family rooms.
Enjoy room-filling sound - Enjoy crisp vocals and dynamic bass response with Dolby processing.
Voice control your music - Stream songs from Amazon Music, Apple Music, Spotify, Sirius XM, and others.
Ready to help - Ask Alexa to play music, answer questions, read the news, check the weather, set alarms, control compatible smart home devices, and more.
Voice control your smart home - Turn on lights, adjust thermostats, lock doors, and more with compatible connected devices.
Connect with others - Call almost anyone hands-free. Instantly drop in on other rooms in your home or make an announcement to every room with a compatible Echo device.
Alexa has skills - With tens of thousands of skills and counting, Alexa is always getting smarter and adding new skills like tracking fitness, playing games, and more.
Designed to protect your privacy - Built with multiple layers of privacy protections and controls, including a microphone off button that electronically disconnects the microphones.
